timeline.message: WIP GEOT-6529 initial steps to update oracle driver
Fix oracle STRUCT and ARRAY deprecation
factor-out deprecated oracle.sql.StructDescriptor and fixup javadoc

factor-out deprecated oracle.sql.StructDescriptor and fixup javadoc

use StringBuilder for improved performance

Ignore  as even in plain SQL it seems to fail

remove/cleanup deprecated ArrayDescriptor and StructDescriptor

GEOT-6529 update oracle driver

Also factor out all Oracle deprecations, notably any use of:

- oracle.sql.STRUCT
- oracle.sql.ARRAY
- oracle.sql.StructDescriptor
- oracle.sql.ArrayDescriptor

Make sure to use the proper driver classname, which is `oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver`,
as well as some javadoc fixes and some replacement of StringBuffer by StringBuilder for improved performance.

Ignore `Oracle3DOnlineTest#testBBOX3DOutsideLine()` as even in plain SQL it seems to fail

[GEOT-6529] Update Oracle JDBC driver

Also factor out all Oracle deprecations, notably any use of:

- oracle.sql.STRUCT
- oracle.sql.ARRAY
- oracle.sql.StructDescriptor
- oracle.sql.ArrayDescriptor

Make sure to use the proper driver classname, which is `oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver`,
as well as some javadoc fixes and some replacement of StringBuffer by StringBuilder for improved performance.

Ignore `Oracle3DOnlineTest#testBBOX3DOutsideLine()` as even in plain SQL it seems to fail

timeline.bodyText: Can we correct the test? JTS does now support the Z and M parameters so it should finally be possible to make this work.
timeline.author: jodygarnett

replies.author: mprins

timeline.message:
[GEOT-6529] Update Oracle JDBC driver

Also factor out all Oracle deprecations, notably any use of:

- oracle.sql.STRUCT
- oracle.sql.ARRAY
- oracle.sql.StructDescriptor
- oracle.sql.ArrayDescriptor

Make sure to use the proper driver classname, which is `oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver`,
as well as some javadoc fixes and some replacement of StringBuffer by StringBuilder for improved performance.

Ignore `Oracle3DOnlineTest#testBBOX3DOutsideLine()` as even in plain SQL it seems to fail

Add a note to use the proper oracle driver class name in the upgrade notes
